intro: Loeseneriella yaundina, commonly known as the Yaoundé daisy, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
